definitions.definition: unpleasant; full of problems

examples.text: I have some **bad news** for you, I'm afraid.
bad weather/dreams/habits
I'm having a really bad day.
It was the worst experience of her life.
Bad breath may be helped by regularly using mouthwash.
War is always a **bad thing**.
That was just **bad luck**.
Things are **bad enough** without our own guns shelling us.
The picnic was cancelled due to bad weather.
The weather got very bad later in the day.
On the last day the weather turned bad.
I'd rather not drive in such bad conditions.
I'm afraid I've got some bad news.
Sunbeds have received a lot of bad publicity in recent years. Are they safe?
The situation couldn't get any worse.
Things were bad enough without her interfering.
Her husband had many bad habits, including gambling.

definitions.definition: of poor quality; below an acceptable standard

examples.text: I thought it was a very bad article.
Bad diet and lack of exercise can lead to serious health problems.
The movie wasn't as bad as I'd expected.
That's not a bad idea.
The service was laughably bad.
I blame it on your bad driving.
Inspectors are looking into the problem of bad prison conditions.

definitions.definition: serious; severe

examples.text: You're heading for a bad case of sunburn.
The engagement was a bad mistake.
My headache is getting worse.
It was a very bad winter that year.

definitions.definition: not appropriate in a particular situation

examples.text: I know that this is a bad time to ask for help.
He now realized that it had been a bad decision on his part.

definitions.definition: morally unacceptable

examples.text: The hero gets to shoot all the bad guys.
He said I must have done something bad to deserve it.
I will not tolerate this bad behaviour.
That girl's a bad influence on Tom.

definitions.definition: not behaving well

examples.text: Have you been a bad boy?

definitions.definition: not able to do something well or in an acceptable way

examples.text: a bad teacher
You're a bad liar!
He's a bad loser *(= he complains when he loses a game)*.
She is so bad at keeping secrets.
He is particularly bad at remembering names.
He's really bad at languages.
Jim was a notoriously bad driver.
I would be a really bad teacher—I've no patience.

definitions.definition: harmful; causing or likely to cause damage

examples.text: Those shoes are bad for her feet.
Weather like this is bad for business.
Too much work is bad for your health.
Smoking is very bad for you.
Watching television is not inherently bad for children.
All those sugary drinks are bad for your teeth.
Eating too much salt is bad for you.
It's bad for you to eat too much salt.

definitions.definition: not healthy; painful

examples.text: I've got a bad back.

definitions.definition: not safe to eat because it has decayed (= started to be destroyed by natural processes)

examples.text: Put the meat in the fridge so it doesn't **go bad**.
The sausages tasted bad.
This meat has gone bad.
There was a smell of bad eggs.

definitions.definition: the state of feeling annoyed or angry

examples.text: It put me in a bad mood for the rest of the day.
John's in a pretty bad mood this morning.

definitions.definition: to feel guilty or sorry about something

examples.text: She felt pretty bad about leaving him.
Why should I want to make you feel bad?
I feel bad enough without you constantly telling me how it was all my fault!

definitions.definition: to feel or look ill

examples.text: I'm afraid I'm feeling pretty bad.

definitions.definition: good; excellent
used to try to persuade somebody to agree that something is good

examples.text: You'll save fifty dollars, which can't be bad, can it?

definitions.definition: to be very much in love

examples.text: You're not seeing him again tonight, are you? That's five times this week—you've got it bad!

definitions.definition: quite good; better than you expected

examples.text: ‘How are you?’ ‘Not too bad.’
That wasn't bad for a first attempt.

definitions.definition: used to say ‘bad luck’ or ‘it’s a shame’ when you do not really mean it

examples.text: If sometimes they're the wrong decisions, too bad.

definitions.definition: a shame; a pity

examples.text: Too bad every day can't be as good as this.

definitions.definition: annoying

examples.text: Really, it was too bad of you to be so late.

wordOrigin: Middle English: perhaps from Old English bǣddel ‘hermaphrodite, womanish man’.
